column1: In those days;there also lived an old soldier called Jack Hannaford.
column2: Naqueles dias existia(vivia)também um velho soldado chamado JackHannaford.

column1: His coat was old and he was poor.
column2: Seu casaco era velho e ele era pobre.

column1: but nobody thought that Jack Hannaford was stupid.
column2: Mas ninguém pensava que Jack Hannaford era estúpido/burro/bobo.

column1: He was sly like a fox.
column2: Ele era astuto/malicioso como uma raposa.

column1: he walked all around the country.
column2: ele caminhou por todo o país.

column1: looking for ways to play his tricks.
column2: procurando por maneiras de “jogar seus truques” (fazer suas artimanhas).

column1: After he had traveled for some time.
column2: Depois que ele tinha viajado por algum tempo.

column1: he came across the farm belonging to the pair.
column2: ele deu de cara com a fazenda que pertencia ao par (ao casal).

column1: He knocked on the door of the house.
column2: Ele bateu na porta da casa.

column1: and a moment later; the wife answered.
column2: E “um momento depois” (pouco depois) a esposa respondeu.

column1: She looked him up and down; quite astonished.
column2: Ela olhou ele de cima a baixo muito surpresa.

column1: because few strangers were able to make the difficult journey to theirhome.
column2: Porque poucos desconhecidos eram capazes de fazer a difícil jornada até a casa deles.

column1: “Where did you come from?” she asked.
column2: De onde você veio ela perguntou.
